description:
Just four easy blocks from historic downtown Bozeman, this modern loft apartment is your perfect retreat. Enjoy a private loft, with modern amenities, just minutes from the best that Bozeman has to offer, shopping, fine dining, and nightlife.

Need a vehicle rental? I’m happy to share my friend’s Turo link after booking.

STR22-00028
host_about:
I'm a born and raised Montanan. I've done some traveling around the world and I just couldn't leave "The Last Best Place". I am a designer at A&E Design, a local Architecture and Design Firm. 

I live in the main house of the property with my black lab mix 'River'.  We spend a lot of our time outside on the river, slopes, hunting, camping, or hanging out in Historic Downtown Bozeman. 

We look forward to accommodating you and your adventure to this great town.

name: Northside Hideaway
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Modern Home Near Campus & Downtown
description:
Great house on the south side of town, near campus. 15 minute drive to airport. 15 minute walk to down town. Sunny porch with grill and fenced in yard.
3 queen size bedrooms with lots of light and 2 full bathrooms. Large kitchen, great for entertaining. Kitchen is equipped with all the basics, but please inquire about specifics.
host_about:
We have been traveling with Airbnb for the past 6 years and have been hosts ourselves for the past 4. We love the experience of staying in a home and getting familiar with a neighborhood when we travel and we are happy to pass that experience along to our guests. 
We reside in Livingston, Montana where we spend our free time floating the rivers, fishing and camping in the summers and skiing at nearby Bridger Bowl in the winter. 
We prefer our privacy and independence when we travel but are always open to local tips and suggestions and we are happy to give you the same when you come to Montana.
We are both local business owners who have a combined 30+ years in the area. We are more than happy to share any knowledge of the area that we have with you. Please ask!

Bozeman Hosting permit #313210
host_about: I'm originally from Colorado and calling Bozeman Montana my home for the last 16 years.  My passions are skiing, fishing, camping, biking, live music and anything outdoors. I hope the location and space of my house serves as a home base for your time in Montana.

name: Sunny Bozeman MSU Cottage
description:
#STR23-00143

Our bright and open Mother-in-Law unit is newly remodeled and in a great location in Bozeman. You can walk or bike to downtown, MSU, neighborhood parks, trails, coffee shops and restaurants. Easy drive to Yellowstone Park and much more to explore.
host_about:
I am a mother of 2 who enjoys to cook and play outside. I love my neighborhood and would not want to live anywhere else in Bozeman- and trust me I have looked but this is the place for me! 
Both my husband and I are from the East coast and travel back as often as possible. 
I love the warm season here and my husband loves the cold-you will get plenty of input from us if you need suggestions on what to do.

name: The Loft: near MSU, private entry, kitchen & baths
description: Our fun & sun-filled Loft has a private entrance, a  newly remodeled and well-stocked full kitchen, a bathroom with shower/tub, a queen & a twin bed, AC, a separate toilet area, a sofa/seating area & a TV with Prime/Netflix/Apple/Max - and an indoor swing! There is a Traeger BBQ & an outdoor dining table + two bikes, and a full washer/dryer & 2nd half bath in the garage. We have designated parking for Loft guests, and are just blocks from the university & historic downtown.    STR 22-00101
host_about:
We moved to Bozeman, Montana from Sonoma County in 2000 with a little kid, two dogs & a cat. The following decades were largely spent renovating this old 1920's home, while juggling all things young families juggle. Thankfully, things are finally slowing down.

Before joining AirBnB, we hosted international students and non-profit workers in "The Loft" - our  private entry guest space  - but have found hosting on AirBnB to be a great experience!

name: Yellow Dogs Cottage: Unique Large Downtown Cottage
description: Yellow Dogs Cottage is a Stylish and uniquely charming cottage is walking distance to Montana State University and town, close to skiing at Bridger Bowl & Big Sky, fishing, hiking, and so much more. Nestled in a lush, historic South-side neighborhood this cottage is thoughtfully and lovingly renovated and decorated. The cottage is always cleaned & sanitized between guests. One space flows into the next, making this a relaxing get-away spot.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Bozeman House with Hottub
description: Beautifully furnished 3 Bedroom home with custom made Montana furniture and hot tub.   Open floor plan ~ covered porches, view of the Bridgers.   Located  close to world class skiing &  fishing .  Close to shopping, schools & restuarants.  Home renting as a short term 6 month rental. Consideration given to two month rental . Great house for professionals or small family building or relocating to Bozeman.
host_about: My husband and I are an active retired couple that enjoy traveling & doing primarily "staycations".  We  decided two years into retirement instead of staying in (Hidden by Airbnb) ’s to turn houses we purchased in Bozeman, Montana (our favorite place)  and Columbia , Missouri into (Hidden by Airbnb) ’s.  We love the lifestyle of living close to our families who are in different states and then renting our houses to people that need short term rentals.  We set our houses up with our guests in mind which simplifies and streamlines our living as well. We have met absolutely wonderful people along this 10 year journey and love the lifestyle. We enjoy hiking, biking, kayaking, fishing, watercolor and most of all hanging out with family.  We try to live by the motto  "treat others as you would have them treat you" and generally all else falls in place.

name: Remote Worker's Dream
description:
Peaceful, clean & comfortable townhouse surrounded by trees located in town close to everything that Bozeman offers. The home's location, layout and amenities make it an ideal retreat for the business traveler or remote worker looking for a new setting.
Only five minutes to downtown, you are 30 minutes (19 miles) to Bridger Bowl; 1 hour (49 miles) to Big Sky Ski Resort and an hour and a half to the Yellowstone Nat’l Park entrance in West Yellowstone (88 miles).
host_about:
Living BIG. Brave, Intentional and Grateful. That is my life motto.

I love exploring nature, hiking, viewing art, cooking and enjoying the company of good friends.  Bozeman is a great connection to all my loves.

Becoming an Airbnb host was a  venture that began after purchasing an R-Pod camper named Grace.  A way to experience new sights and new experiences. So when I am not in the peaceful surroundings of my townhouse, you will find me and Gerty, my 11 pound Brussels Griffon, enjoying the solitude of the mountains just outside the steps of Grace.

name: Downtown Red Chair Retreat
description: With the reYour own private entrance with one bedroom, one sitting room with futon couch/bed and a bathroom.  Sitting room has smart TV, bluetooth stereo.  This 2nd floor dwelling has no kitchen facilities but is located in a quiet neighborhood only 2 blocks from restaurants, shopping and nightlife in downtown Bozeman. host_about: I have been a resident of Bozeman for 40 years and former Director of Marketing and Reservations at Bridger Bowl for 28 years.  I'm also an avid Nordic skier, cyclist, fly fisherman, traveler and a musician. I've cuurently combined interest in Latin percussion and travels to Cuba to do a cross-cultural music project with musicians from Santiago de Cuba and Bozeman.  I've also served on Yellowstone Country of Montana regional tourism board for many years and know the area very well.  I love food ...and I know where to find the good stuff!

name: Heron's Nest
description: Welcome to your perfect Bozeman retreat! This loft-style apartment is situated in a fantastic neighborhood, just half a block from a beautiful 5-acre park, trail system, and trout-stocked pond. Positioned above a detached two-car garage, the unit offers privacy with no shared walls and vaulted ceilings that create an open and airy atmosphere.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Modern Farmhouse in Historic Downtown Bozeman
description:
Bright, modern, and tastefully appointed, this newly-built, gold-LEED house has it all. Cook in the light-flooded gourmet chef's kitchen; lounge in the beautiful backyard; enjoy your coffee on the back terrace or stroll to Main Street in just a few minutes.

Rest easy in this fully legal rental--we are registered with both Bozeman (Registration #17593) and Montana. With us your travel plans are 100% secure.
host_about:
We have lived in the Bozeman area over 20 years and envisioned this dream home, which we built in 2010, as a blend of local historical architecture and modern design trends. It is our once and future primary residence, but while we're living out of state much of the year, we are ready to share our home with you. 
Sincerely, Otto & Anne

description:
We have over 186 five star reviews on VRBO as well as those you see here on Airbnb!
Bring your friends and family to this unique artsy home. Located in Bozeman's hip North East Neighborhood. Fully designed & remodeled with an artist's eye. Minutes walk to the heart of Main street. Enjoy luxurious sleep on our new organic hybrid mattresses & super soft 100% bamboo sheets! We prioritize health so that your can get out and fill your days with adventure and then sink into comfort!

name: Stroll to Meyers Lake, Airy Two Bedroom Guesthouse
description:
Sleep in soft, beautiful bed linens with pretty patterns. Wake to songbirds, mountain views, and the smell of locally roasted coffee. Generous windows let natural light into fresh spaces filled with timeless, elegant furnishings. Petrified bamboo floors, & granite and stainless steel appliances add a special touch. A gleaming kitchen and living room offer panoramic Montana mountain views. Walking paths are just 1/2 block away to Myers Lake.

STR-2200029: City Hosting Permit Number
host_about:
We love cooking and eating good food (especially ethnic!), music (eclectic), wine, travel, art, and time spent outdoors. Designed for the more independent traveler - our style of hosting is more hands off, allowing guests to experience Bozeman on their own agenda. *We are, however; always available by call or text to answer any question guests may have! 

We can't live without our fly-rods, skis, tents/Rpod, travel, and our hiking shoes. Our 13 year old Golden Retriever keep us thoroughly entertained!

Adventure meets luxury is our travel style; both domestically and internationally. 

Our MO: if you remain open to life, then no matter how old you are chronologically, you are still young. Also, run your own race!

name: Bozeman On Trails, near Downtown
description:
Great house with plenty of light and mountain views. Modern and nicely furnished. Conveniently located in a quiet neighborhood close to downtown.

Gorgeous backyard with beautiful patio, both sun and shade, bordering incredible ‘Mountain to Main’ wide-trails directly behind the property, for; walking, biking, hiking and xc skiing. These trails are not busy but such a lovely respite from the busy hustle of downtown.

Please know Air Conditioning is not* included in nightly rates.
AC available.
host_about:
I’ve been enjoying the MAGICAL 
outdoors from the mountains to the ocean all of my life. 

Bozeman usually has beautiful weather, with too many summer activities to list from biking hiking kitesurfing you name it!…winter skiing both downhill + xc are some of the best in the world. The fishing is phenomenal, the people amazingly friendly + the town of Bozeman has so much to offer..Come play in the outdoors!  Happy to make some great suggestions!

name: Downtown Urban Chic
description: This studio apartment is located 3 blocks north of historic downtown Bozeman. Private free parking, private patio with chiminea, separate entrance, lush flower gardens, nearby shopping, pubs, restaurants, Willson Theatre and community parks.  MSU is 1.5 miles from our home.
host_about:
I moved to Bozeman over 30 years ago to attend college at MSU, and decided this was my home.  I am a Montessori teacher, my husband, Brian, is a lawyer and a native to Montana. We love the outdoors including; hiking, fishing, golfing and playing tennis.  
We love to travel, some of our most recent trips include; Australia, Italy, Belize, Turkey, Africa, Spain, Amsterdam and Switzerland. We love staying at other Airbnbs when we travel

name: Rustic-Contemporary Downtown
description: Enjoy the Bozeman vibe in the NEBO district on Fridley Street. name: Charming Campus Home
description: Relax in the comfort of our charming 2-bedroom retreat, conveniently located blocks away from campus and the vibrant downtown of Bozeman. Whether you're gearing up for the mountains or eager to delve into local attractions such as the Museum of the Rockies, our home serves as the ideal launch pad for adventure. After a day of exploration, unwind in our cozy home, where comfort and convenience await. Every detail has been thoughtfully curated to ensure a comfortable stay. We’re happy to host you!
host_about: I grew up in Bozeman after moving here as young child from Canada. I love to travel, meet people from all around the world, and get outside to play as much as life allows. My husband and I feel lucky to get to raise our kids in Bozeman, and to share the town we love with travelers who love exploring the world as much as we do!

description: We are a safe, clean, and affordable hostel located in the middle of Main Street in downtown Bozeman. name: Walk to Downtown! Historic Studio with Sun
description:
This charming second story studio sanctuary is full of light and warmth with picture windows, a breakfast nook, a lovely patio and outdoor grill just below. Comfortable queen bed ( as well as a good full airbed with a set of sheets if needed additionally). Great location! with easy access to downtown within a few blocks and immediate access to roads leading to wilderness, skiing and hiking. Treehouse in summer, cozy nest in winter.

License # 312682
host_about: Hello, I am a fourth generation Montana Native, born in Bozeman. I am a visual artist/photographer and wilderness lover. My father was a fishing guide and renowned naturalist in this area so I can show you some out of the way places that won't appear in your guidebooks, as well as some of the tucked away local hangs. Montana is known for her friendly folks. We fit the bill here at the Colburn House.  Let us host you Montana style! Lively, friendly and spacious.

name: Garden Cottage
description: Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bridger guesthouse, 1/2 way between MSU/Downtown!
description:
This spacious 3 bed apartment is in an ideal Bozeman location. It is about a mile walk north to downtown, a mile walk west to MSU, a mile walk to the south lies the Museum of the Rockies, and a mile to the east on top of Peet's Hill in Burke Park.

Enjoy a home away from home, during your visit to Bozeman, at Bridger Guest House.
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

description:
Our lovely home has been described as "Country living in the city" and, as such, the location cannot be beat. Our quiet street provides a nice setting for relaxation and splendid views of the surrounding area. We are an easy walk or drive to MSU or downtown (1/2 mile to Main St.).

name: Great Room & Location with Private Bath & Balcony
description: Greetings! We've upgraded the space and added a door at the top landing for additional privacy for our long-term guests.  Stay within walking distance to MSU, Museum of the Rockies, Coffee, Restaurants, a 24-hour gym, and ice cream by the scoop! You’ll love this home because of the tree-house/ski chalet feel and the views to the hills from your own large balcony.  Trails are close by, bikes are available for use, and there is plenty of parking in the neighborhood.
host_about: Greetings!  I choose Montana as my home when I was 6 years old, after seeing pictures of Glacier National Park.  Nutley, New Jersey is a great place to be from, and Bozeman, Montana has been a wonderful place to live for the last 34 years.  Outdoor adventure, dancing, dinosaurs under the microscope, and ice skating fill my days.  You will find plenty of books on science and spirituality in our cool and cozy home - as well as an indoor slack-line!

host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us. name: Cabin On Montana: Clean 3-bedroom 2-bath home
description: The Cabin On Montana offers guests a quiet comfortable place to stay while visiting beautiful Bozeman, Montana. The cabin was fully renovated in the summer and fall of 2016. It is well adorned with new mattresses, furniture, and appliances. The cabin is well situated with quick access to Bridger Bowl and other highlights in the area. It is a short walk or bike to the center of downtown or one of Bozeman's many breweries or restaurants.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Bozeman - Modern/Rustic 1 bedroom w/ Loft bedroom
description: My place is close (7 minutes) to nightlife, the airport, parks, and the city center. It is 15 minutes to skiing at Bridger Bowl. You’ll love my place because of the kitchen, the coziness, the high ceilings, the views, and the location. The location is extremely private at the end of the road yet 5 minutes to town. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. The loft area has mountain views out all windows. Custom mattresses, assortment of pillows.
host_about:
I am a Washington State Native with a degree in Economics from University of San Diego. I am a licensed Realtor with Knoff Group Real Estate and I love searching for the perfect property for buyers.  I like to hike, bike, ski and adventure.  Please let me know if you need help finding real estate in one of the last best places. 

I want to make your stay as pleasant as possible so let me know if you need anything.

host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us. name: Bridger Creek Luxury home near Bridger Bowl Skiing
description:
This luxury Legends Chalet located in the Bridger Creek neighborhood in Bozeman is a well-appointed 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom home. The home is surrounded by trails for hiking, biking or taking a stroll with friends and family. Within blocks of the home you will find the Bridger Creek Golf Course, and just a short drive through the canyon will land you at Bridger Bowl, where you can "ski the cold smoke."

The home is very cozy with an open floor plan and high ceilings.

name: Welcome to Madison Guest House!
description: With 3 beds and 1 bath, and 2 outdoor spaces, in roughly 900 sq ft, the home is a welcome respite from the road, or plane! The home has wifi, full laundry/bath/and kitchen and 2 off street parking spots.
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

name: Spacious 3bed/2bath Bozeman home
description:
*NOTE: Our home is only available for reservations of 30 nights or more.*

Welcome to our spacious 3b/2b single-story home, nestled in a quiet neighborhood among beautiful Big Sky Country. With a wealth of nearby parks, easy access to Bozeman's historic downtown with its local shopping and trendy restaurants, let our home be the basecamp for your unforgettable adventure. The light, airy layout makes for an easy departure from the clutter and chaos of the real world.
host_about: We love to travel, and during our adventures in Europe, Costa Rica, and the Caribbean Islands, we've noticed that it's the little things that make all the itinerary planning and redeye flights worth it. Originally from California, we've fallen in love with the wilds of Montana and Wyoming, and plan to start a family in Bozeman one day. In the spirit of family, we'd love to invite you into our home, so that you can experience all the magic we felt when first exploring this exciting, crazy, beautiful land.

name: Bozeman Creek Loft
description:
Modern loft on the southside of Bozeman. Great views and open space full of wildlife.

Close to downtown, MSU and the Bobcat stadium. Walk or bike downtown on Bozeman's great network of trails or hike up the hill to enjoy a beautiful Montana sunset.

The apartment is on top of the garage and has a separate entrance. One bedroom with king bed, upper loft with two twin beds, full kitchen, bath, living/dining area and laundry. Everything you need for your stay!

name: Key Lime Pie under the Big Sky - private entrance
description: Cozy, quaint, and cost-effective, we offer a private room with a comfortable queen bed in downtown Bozeman.  We're four short blocks from the heart of historic Main Street and the main Streamline bus stop/hub.  There is a fenced back yard, a dedicated back door entrance, and a portable privacy wall - to give you your 'space' (well.....and us too).  Our eclectic 60's rancher is a short drive to the local ski hills, golf courses, and MSU. BozS-TRegSTR22-00047.
host_about: I work at Montana State University, have two grown sons, and am an avid golfer.  I love to travel, meet new people, and I research stained glass windows that represent American civil religion.

name: Quilt Cottage
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

Room in a brand-new, modern eco house in probably THE BEST location in Bozeman.

Reg.#STR20-00267

Your room (w/ walk-in closet) and private bathroom are on the 1st floor near the front door. Main living is on the 2nd floor. Master bedroom is in the basement. So, you can come and go with as little or much interaction as you prefer.

name: The Bungalow Downtown
description:
This 1912 craftsman home is in the heart of old Bozeman! Two turns off the interstate takes you to the front door and downtown is only a few blocks away! Vaulted ceilings, wood floors, and everything you need to enjoy your stay!
Caution: The floors of this house creek. You can hear guests above walking.
FAQ: the stairway dead-ends at the top.

We are dog friendly with a $10/dog pet fee. Please get approval if brining more than 2 dogs. Cats are not allowed without prior approval

name: "NEW" Coldsmoke Getaway, Steps From Lake & Trails
description:
This modern "two-story treasure" has everything you need for a memorable get away!
Our two spacious studio apartments are on separate levels, but are rented as one unit.
Enjoy two separate studio rooms for the hotel price of one!!
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Retreat Under Bozeman's Big Sky Near Yellowstone
description:
Comfortable and clean 2-level townhome located in heart of Bozeman, Montana. Perfect for a family getaway.

Close to Whole Foods & Texas Roadhouse, 2 miles to MSU, Bobcat stadium, Museum of Rockies, Downtown Bozeman, 19 miles to Bridger Bowl & 1 hour to Big Sky & Yellowstone National Park.

Includes high speed internet, Smart TV w/Netflix, cable, washer & dryer & fully equipped kitchen.

Private backyard deck & landscaped private space for grilling or relaxing.

Bozeman Permit STR20-00110
host_about: I work and live in Bozeman and am excited to share my townhouse with visitors to this beautiful area.

name: 'Bozeman Getaway' w/ Mountain Views, Near Downtown
description: 'Bozeman Getaway' invites you to explore the Northern Rocky Mountains and quaint local attractions for your next adventure! This 4-bedroom, 3.5-bath vacation rental condo was built in 2005 and has since been meticulously maintained, with accommodations for guests on a quick retreat or extended stay. Walk to local restaurants and Bozeman's largest fitness center, enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and more in the nearby Bridger Mountains, or take a day trip to visit Yellowstone Park!
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: Contemporary Downtown Townhome
description: Ideally located three blocks from historic main street, this beautiful newer condo has views of the Bridger Mountains from the upper wrap around deck and is spacious and modern inside. Garage parking included.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Red Chair Townhouse
description: Located in a quiet neighborhood only 3 blocks from Downtown Bozeman, this town house encompasses the front portion of the main house.  This is a very unique property with  private living quarters (owner occupied) on the backside of the main house which is attached to the living space above the garage.  There is also a separate Airbnb apartment (no kitchen) upstairs with its own private entrance, called the RedChair Retreat.   These spaces are separate and private. - STR23-00001
host_about: I have been a resident of Bozeman for 40 years and former Director of Marketing and Reservations at Bridger Bowl for 28 years.  I'm also an avid Nordic skier, cyclist, fly fisherman, traveler and a musician. I've cuurently combined interest in Latin percussion and travels to Cuba to do a cross-cultural music project with musicians from Santiago de Cuba and Bozeman.  I've also served on Yellowstone Country of Montana regional tourism board for many years and know the area very well.  I love food ...and I know where to find the good stuff!

This spacious townhome was designed with you in mind!
We fashioned this home with many added comforts for a memorable vacation getaway.
Come relax and unwind in our cozy Bozone Bliss!
FYI- Our cleaning fee is $225 combined w/ $45 damage fee.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: The Cozy Bear - STR23-00010
description:
The Cozy Bear is the perfect all-weather accommodation. Central heat and air and an enclosed single car garage. The apartment is an ADU -Accessary Dwelling Unit- located above the garage, accessed from the alley behind the main house.

Vaulted ceilings and many windows give this upstairs apartment a feeling of spaciousness. Regional artwork reflect the owners' love of Montana.
Perfect location-ten minutes from downtown and MSU. An hour to Big Sky. .

name: Chickadee's Nest
description: Welcome to your bright and airy retreat in Bozeman! This newly renovated studio apartment, updated in the fall of 2018, offers modern comfort and efficiency in a prime location. Just a 3-minute drive or a 10-minute walk from Montana State University, it is perfect for visitors seeking convenience and style.
host_about:
I am a Montana native, born and raised in Bozeman. I love it here and I never get tired of the breath taking mountain views.  I have been managing my own real estate rentals for over 20 years and appraising real estate here in the Gallatin Valley since 2007.  I am also a real estate broker at Starner Commercial Real Estate in Bozeman Montana.

I like to travel to warm locations. My husband and I honeymooned in Thailand and I hope to visit again someday.   My hobbies include hiking, spending time with family and working on real estate deals.   I've enjoyed being an AirBnB host and all the great people I've met along the way!

name: Big Sky Bozeman 2 BR Suite, Perfect for Kids/Pets
description: Our spacious 2BR suite in always-popular Bozeman might just be the Big Sky experience you’ve been searching for! We’re kid and pet-friendly and hope you bring them along to enjoy the gorgeous mountain and golf course views. We think we’re in the perfect location, with ski-in/ski-out, golf-in/golf-out, and fish-in/fish-out just minutes or even seconds from our door. We’re also just 5 minutes from downtown Bozeman for shopping, & dining 15 mins from the closest ski resort. STR20-00319
host_about:
Hello, my name is Erik and my lovely wife and cohost is Pepper. We originally built our 1200 sq. ft. addition for our family to come visit us but as they aged and with covid, it got too hard for them to visit. So we decided to start sharing it with guests from all over the world and it has been a wonderful experience. We truly love meeting our wonderful guests and getting to know them. 

Like so many other hosts, our family of 5 (plus Timber, our 1.5-year-old Chocolate Lab) loves to travel and we have been fortunate to see many places around the world.  Living in Montana has given all of us a deep appreciation of the natural world and its infinite activities. We all enjoy hiking, camping, rock climbing, and skiing. We have hiked all over Yellowstone and throughout the Gallatin mountains. 

In the springtime, I fly fish almost nightly in the two rivers behind our home on the other side of the Bridger Creek Golf Course.

When we’re not ticking off the boxes on our family bucket list, I am a Customer Service Representative for Delta and United Airlines and Pepper is a Pediatrician at Bozeman Deaconess Hospital.

We can’t wait to meet you!

name: Master Bedroom Suite onTrail System accommodates 1
description:
A beautiful well appointed guest room accommodations for ONE guest, a queen sized bed with attached master bathroom, including a large bathtub for relaxing soaks. The light is beautiful, pretty views full of seasonal flowers and Mountain views.

Our house is set on a quiet street, abutting trails and lush mountain views. Set in a lovely quiet neighborhood not far from Main St but away from the noise of downtown.

We welcome single travelers.
We have a small older dog that guests love.
host_about:
I’ve been enjoying the MAGICAL 
outdoors from the mountains to the ocean all of my life. 

Bozeman usually has beautiful weather, with too many summer activities to list from biking hiking kitesurfing you name it!…winter skiing both downhill + xc are some of the best in the world. The fishing is phenomenal, the people amazingly friendly + the town of Bozeman has so much to offer..Come play in the outdoors!  Happy to make some great suggestions!

name: Andon Rise - 3rd floor loft
description:
Cozy loft filled with natural light, modern design, and incredible views. Enjoy morning coffee on your private deck overlooking the Audubon Society Wetland with hawks, sandhill cranes, whitetail deer and amazing views of the Bridger Mountain Range. 5-minute stroll to the heart of Main Street, with countless eateries and breweries or eat-in, you have a fully equipped kitchen.
15-minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort and 2-minute walk to Lindley Park with biking/hiking/groomed XC ski trails.

name: Cozy, Clean & Great location w/Mountain Views
description: Single level, clean, cozy, modern. 15 min. from airport. Full Kitchen, DW, and well appointed. New mattresses, high quality linens, good pillows, gas fireplace, 2 smart tvs with internet cable, high speed WiFi, 2 full baths, tiled walk-in shower, bathtub, plush towels, quality shampoo/conditioner, bath gel, lotion. Great coffee and tea, comfy couch, desk. Private patio with outside propane fire. A/C, Washer/dryer. Great central location to amenities. Plenty of parking and garage. Mountain Views.
host_about: Hi there! I've lived in Bozeman since 1987. I absolutely love Montana and love sharing it. I work hard here in order to play and stay here. I believe that Montana has a special energy and have thought that ever since I first visited, the people and the land. Big Sky country, the Last Best Place, all true descriptions, stunningly beautiful, you can see for miles and although we have longer winters here than some, the sun shines more here than any other place I have lived.

name: Bridger Sunrise Town Home 1 Bedroom
description: A quiet & cozy spot in the heart of Bozeman, where you can read a book by the fire or sit outside, on the covered patio, and be amazed by the views of the Bridger Mountains. name: The Westside Nest - Cozy & Convenient!
description: This quaint little townhome is just minutes from shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, parks, MSU campus, hiking trails, downtown and more! Guests can easily access main roads or hop on the Streamline Bus, making visiting local hot spots a breeze. Take a day trip to soak in the nearby hotsprings, explore the caverns, visit Yellowstone, or simply experience the beautiful town of Bozeman, and return home to enjoy all the amenities this cozy home has to offer. Come relax at The Westside Nest!
host_about: Tess is my name and dancing is my game! I'm a Minnesota transplant who found her way to Montana for school and have stayed in the mountains ever since. When traveling, I'm either flanked by my fantastic husband, a group of amazing girlfriends or a handful of crazy family members. I like to relax, check out nightlife, shop and explore fun hot spots when I visit new places. Point me towards the best burger joint in town where I can enjoy live music and a local brew, and I'm a happy camper!

name: Fridley Studio: Downtown on Bozeman's North Side
description:
This is a lovely little standalone studio on Bozeman's Northside. Built in 2004, this studio is clean, tidy, and in great condition.

Located on Wallace Ave and within a few blocks of downtown, it's midway between Wild Crumb and Montana Ale Works.

This is a medium-term rental, with a minimum 30-day stay required. Longterm discounts are negotiable.

FYI: We only list this property on Airbnb. Listings on other online platforms are fraudulent. Beware!
host_about:
Amy is the Development Program Manager for The Nature Conservancy in Montana. She has also worked as an expedition leader for the eco-tourism company Orbridge, hosting travelers across the western US and on the rivers of Western Europe. 

Amy's husband Chris is the founder of Habitat X, director of the Montana Weatherization Training Center, and an author in the sustainable housing industry.

Amy and Chris live in Bozeman, Montana.

name: West Olive Cottage
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

host_about:
I was born and raised under Montana's Big Sky.
I had the good fortune of raising my three beautiful children in the aptly named Paradise Valley.    
I currently live and work in Bozeman, Montana.  I use the trail systems daily, frequent the wonderful restaurants and support my wonderful community. My passions are family, cycling, paddle boarding, kayaking, hiking and camping.  I have traded my skis in for snowshoes

name: Tenderfoot Cottage
description: Offering monthly discount for Jan-March 2021
host_about:
Dream MT Properties, formally "Cozy Creek", is proud to be a small rental agency that gives special attention to its owners as well as guests. When planning your next trip to the Big Sky area, you will deal with very few people who understand what it takes to make a vacation great for your group coming in.  We pride ourselves in have a properties that are clean, well stocked, and in a great location.

Not only are we a small company that delivers one on one customer service, we also love giving free advice on where to eat, hike, ski, fish, play and sight see while you are visiting.

name: Creekside Cottage on Bozeman Creek
description: Cozy 2 bedroom cottage conveniently located in a beautiful private setting in the middle of town right next to Bozeman Creek.  Cottage has 2 master suites, each with its own bathroom.  Private deck and access to Bozeman creek which runs all year round.  Walking distance to Montana State University and about 1 mile from historic downtown Bozeman.  Parks as well as hiking and cross country ski trails are located nearby.  Downhill skiing and Yellowstone Park are within driving distance.
host_about:
My family and I  feel  so fortunate to be living in an area of the country that many people desire to visit. As an Airbnb host we hope that our cottage and hospitatlity are as impressive as the scenery surrounding our beautiful city. We want your trip to Bozeman to be all that it can be and we know that it all starts with a memorable lodging experience. 
If you are thinking about moving to Monatana I would feel privlaged to help you find that perfect property to call home. I am a License Realtor in the State of Montana and I would love to send you listings prior to your visit. 
My family and I look forward to your visit and until then take care and stay healthy.

name: Peach House
description: Free, fast 400 Meg Spectrum Wi-Fi. Keyless self check-in. Whole house rental, no other living spaces on property. Free EV charger!
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact. I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

name: Comfortable and Modern Bozeman Abode
description: Situated on quiet street in the heart of Bozeman, minutes from downtown, with many options for dining, entertainment & shopping. This lovely place is a great home base!  Go enjoy the surrounding mountains and rivers, experience the Montana life style! Montana summers are fabulous & there are great day trip hikes in every direction. host_about:
Hello fellow travelers!  My husband and I love to travel and we love to stay in Airbnb’s.  
We realized that this is the best way to stay so in 2018 we set up a home in Phoenix  (where we live) so that our kids and our grandkids could have a place to stay when they come visit.  We also have a home in Montana, which is where I am from.  Much of my family still lives in Bozeman so we set up our home away from so we wouldn’t wear out our welcome when we come to visit!  Our Bozeman abode is beautiful and is located in the heart of the town.    We are very glad to be able to share our home away from home airbnb’s with you!

name: Downtown Bungalow - side door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown, or walking distance to Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Lindley House
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in. Ionizing fogger sterilization between rentals in addition to Covid cleaning protocols to keep you (and us) safe!
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Peach Street Guesthouse | Best Location in BZN
description:
Garden Guesthouse in Bozeman's best neighborhood. Walking distance to downtown. Two blocks away from Bozeman Brewing and Mountains Walking Brewery. Right across the street from Wild Crumb Bakery (best bakery EVER) and Fink's Deli . 20 minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort so that you can have first tracks! The neighborhood is amazing and authentic. Experience Bozeman like a local.

We have a garden and 4 chickens on the property. They will say hello, you have been warned!
host_about:
Hello there, my name is Emily :)
I live with my partner, Ben.

We love to climb mountains, ski & snowboard, go fishing and get outside as much as we can. Bozeman has access to endless amounts of outdoor recreation, which is one of the main reasons we both ended up in this mountain town.

We are both in the hospitality industry. Ben is a product designer and I am in marketing. 

We are passionate about becoming great hosts and sharing the place that we call home. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. 

We look forward to having you as our guest! 

Welcome to Bozeman!

name: Cozy & Luxe "Lagom1Stay" Top Floor Loft Downtown
description: This cozy "Lagom" loft is a well appointed stay. A short walk to downtown Bozeman & MSU. Enjoy the local foodie & shopping scenes. Venture to Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy unforgettable Montana experiences hiking & biking in the mountains or fishing in the rivers. Hit the local world class Big Sky Ski Resort or Bridger Bowl, & soak in local Hot Springs. Retire in luxury & comfort while watching the sun peak over the Mountains from your private balcony. City Hosting Permit Number #STR20-00391
host_about:
We are Abigail & Eric! We are excited to have you stay! Born & raised Montanans, designer & builder come together to create a beautiful Montana experience just for you.  We are excited to help you navigate Montana & can send a guide on what to bring based on what adventures you plan on having. We have recommendations galore! Want to go skiing, hiking, have day trips, or enjoy fishing? Go out & have an incredible meal, enjoy local walks, & events? We are happy to assist. Montana is truly "Big Sky" country & has the ability to take your breath away. These trips are memories which last. 

Our family enjoys an array of outdoor adventures & love traveling to experience local moments wherever we go. We ski, snowboard, ice-skate, sled, hike, & dip into hot springs. On our hikes we love waterfalls & enjoy sitting around a fire in the mountains sipping on honey tea. Life is a sensory experience & we are thrilled to share these beautiful places we enjoy immensely with you.

name: Immaculate Downtown Bozeman Condo 1 Block off Main
description: Enjoy downtown Bozeman and beyond in this beautiful and cozy Montana Mid-Century Modern condo, a conveniently located 2020 construction only one block from Main! Perfect for couples or the single traveler, you'll have a reserved parking space, a fully-equipped kitchen, high speed WiFi, smart TV with cable, a private balcony to enjoy your morning coffee, convenient 24-7 keyless access from your phone (or a code), and many more amenities as described below. We look forward to welcoming you!
host_about:
Ambrose is a front-end web developer, video game developer, and short-story writer. Jill is a software engineer, a violinist for the Bozeman Symphony Orchestra, a private math tutor, and fluent German speaker. We both love meeting new people and sharing the beauty of Bozeman.

As guests, we are respectful of the space, clean and tidy, laid back, and polite. We love exploring new areas,  eating at exotic restaurants, and learning about the local history and architecture. Being hosts ourselves, we are mindful of what goes into hosting and want to make things as easy and pleasant as possible for all parties.

name: Trailer Glamping of Story Hills
description: Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills.  The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location.  Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown.  It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl  is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

name: Bozeman Retreat - Clean, Comfortable, Downtown
description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. Guests will sleep well on a medium-profile hybrid mattress combining the benefits of a traditional innerspring with a thick layer of cushioning memory foam. There is plenty of parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Downtown Bozeman Birdhouse
description: Central AC, Free, fast 400 Meg Ultra Spectrum Wifi*** Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bozeman Retreat: Hip, Clean, Comfortable, Downtown
description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. There is plenty of off-street parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

description: Enjoy easy access to all Bozeman has to offer from this perfectly located home base. Walk downtown to restaurants, shops & nightlife. Conveniently located to MSU. host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact. name: Downtown Bungalow - front door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

host_about:
Some numbers: In the (12) years I’ve been a member of the AirBnB community, I've stayed in over (100) AirBnBs across (6) continents, rented out (5) of my living spaces while traveling, and met my (1)  husband while staying in his AirBnB.  

To say I love this platform is an understatement.  It has fundamentally changed how I navigate the world and provides me with the freedom to see more of it.

I aim to be the best host you've ever had because I understand first hand how important accommodation is to a great experience on the road.

name: ADU208: Immaculate 1-bedroom downtown ADU
description: Unwind in the sizable comforts of this small modern space.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Western Magic - 3 Bedroom + Office Bozeman Condo
description: Western Magic is a spacious condo with 3 bedrooms, a fully equipped remote office with standup desk, supplies, & printer, and a fully stocked kitchen - to make the most of your Bozeman getaway. Enjoy a covered front patio for entertaining and relaxing, and a back patio for grilling with a large gas grill.  Located on the west edge of Bozeman, with views of the Bridgers and easy access to Big Sky or Bridger Bowl skiing, fly fishing, trails, downtown, and major stores. Family-friendly. No pets.
host_about:
Adventure mom, strategic marketer, sustainability & geotourism advocate.  I have 2 homes I rent when I am not in them, in Western North Carolina and in Bozeman, Montana. I know the WNC area around Bryson City, Nantahala Gorge, Sylva, Cherokee and across the park into Gatlinburg very well.  I also know the Bozeman and Greater Yellowstone Valley quite well after more than a decade of living there. I am a keen skier - alpine, telemark, xc classic and xc skate  as well as a fly fisherwoman, hiker, and biker. I love to help others find the right adventure activities, and places to go and see, for your vacation success.  

Hiking, float trips, white water rafting, lake paddling, waterfalls, mountain biking trails, best roads for road biking, best motorcycle touring roads, best skiing and rivers to fish are all things I'd love to help you find! Am very kid-centric, so am happy to be a great resource for the best things to do with kids from tiny tots to adventure loving teens.  I run an adventure tourism and travel marketing agency, so helping others find big and small adventures in cool places is in my DNA.

name: Access Friendly Location. Airport, MSU & Trails
description:
Bring the whole family (plus pet) for your basecamp in Bozeman. Ideally located near MSU, Yellowstone National Park and the airport for your work commute.

This spacious property offers an abundance of space for spreading your luggage out in each bedroom (3). A full kitchen is provided with use of pots, pans, Ninja blender, cast iron pans and more. High speed internet is included along with free parking.

This is a non-smoking household. Please enjoy at a near park and not in or at the house.
host_about: Avid outdoor enthusiast making the most out of exploring Montana and opening my doors to help you do the same! As a Bozeman resident for just over 3 years, originally hailing from the Great Lakes state of Michigan, I'm driven to put many miles in by foot, bike, skis and water ways. The state boasts incredible recreational opportunities with two spectacular National Parks and countless National Forests. Reach out as I'm always happy to recommend lovely meandering trails or delicious food around the area.

name: Private 2 Bedroom Suite - Near Downtown & MSU
description:
Base your Bozeman stay at our private, clean, cozy, bright, and convenient 2 queen bedroom/1 bath BASEMENT suite in our 1950s home near Downtown and MSU. We can host up to 4 guests. 2 desks, WiFi, 2 Smart Roku TVs, laundry, linens & toiletries. Efficient kitchen and dining area.

host_about:
Sarah and I love living in Bozeman but also like to travel and adventure throughout the western US and the world, often on bikes. At home we spend our free time outdoors hiking, running, riding mountain and gravel bikes in the summer and nordic skiing, snow biking, and ice climbing in the winter. When traveling we prioritize exploration and adventures.

As hosts we welcome you and try hard to provide a clean, comfortable, convenient, and affordable base for your Bozeman visit and adventures. We are happy to share years of local knowledge about fun things to do in the Bozeman area including hiking, skiing, backpacking, ice climbing, mountain-biking, visiting Yellowstone National Park, and places to shop or eat around town.

name: King Bed, Workstation, & Fast WiFi
description:
Digital Nomad Dream Apartment

This 1 bedroom / 1 bath apartment is right smack dab in the middle of Bozeman. 1.2 miles to Downtown, 3.4 miles to the hospital, 17 miles to Bridger Bowl, and 44 miles to Big Sky

100mbps WiFi + desk & ergonomic chair + 21" Monitor with HDMI port

All utilities included and no chores required. You will be able to relax!

Very private and quiet. No shared walls with neighbors.

Free Parking right outside your door.

In-unit washer + dryer.

Central Heat/AC.
host_about:
Hi there! My name is Cooper and I grew up in the lowcountry of South Carolina. I developed a love for the outdoors at a very young age and enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and anything on the water. 

I work remote for a software company you have probably used before and love the flexibility it gives me in terms of work locations / home offices. I have been to 32+ countries and want to keep adding to my list. What is your favorite country? 

When I travel I prefer to stay for longer visits to spread my roots into the local communities. 28+ day stays are my speciality so all of my units are equipped for mid term stays. Think standup desks, fast wifi, everything you need to cook, and welcoming spaces.

Making sure you have a smooth check in and the ability to ask any questions during your stay is my #1 priority.

name: **Downtown Bozeman Historic Main Street Condo**
description: On Historic Main Street, this charming condo with alley access includes: a LED fireplace, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, fully stocked kitchen, Smart TV with surround sound, at home work station, air exchange system bringing fresh air to the windowless basement, and pictures galore providing a picturesque motif of The Speak Easy Era. host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

name: Dwell Skyview
description: Newly built in 2017 and already a favorite. Remote work haven in prime location, free/fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in. Smart TV.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: New!  Wonderful location! The Amble on Inn.
description: Montana has so much to offer year round. The Big sky is breathtaking.  Hiking, white water rafting, fishing, and breathing in all that mountain air.  Our well appointed condo is centrally located in Midtown Bozeman. Right off Main Street and North 7th Ave.  Clean and uncluttered, There is an in suite washer and dryer.  The kitchen is well equipped for cooking.  Easy access to eateries, groceries,  all with an old town Main street,  which is a wonderful place to walk.   All on grade level.
host_about: A little about myself,  I spent 20 years as a designer and three years as an Art Educator for k-12.    For recreation, I love to cycle.  I feel like flying when I am on a bike.  Something about the wind in my face, the aroma of the surroundings, and the sweat on my brow. I love the view when cycling down the open road.  I love visiting new vacation homes, it is wonderful to see what each host offers.  I decided to set up an airbnb to host travelers coming to my area.  I grew up in The Gallatin Valley on the river and Graduated from Montana State University.    "Living life with creative zeal".  Laura Jean

name: South Bozeman Betty
description: Bring family and friends to enjoy and experience a bohemian eclectic treasure just two and a half blocks south of downtown Bozeman. Free/fast Wi-Fi. Hot tub. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Luxury Bozeman, Montana Cottage Rental
description:
In order to truly experience Bozeman and the abundance of attractions that make Montana "the most livable place", we would love for you to visit and even stay a while! Welcome to The Cottage: a luxury free standing condo offering both nightly and 30+ day stays, just minutes from downtown Bozeman with shopping and nightlife.

The Cottage was built with opulence, functionalism and attention to detail at the core of every design decision. A home away from home, the Lux Cottage is waiting for you.
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

name: The Downtown Bozeman Guest House
description: Welcome to your home in downtown Bozeman! This 3-bedroom, 1,500 sq. foot house has been our home for 16 years and we are excited to now share it with guests and visitors to Bozeman. This is as close to downtown a single-family home can be. Only two blocks to Main Street and 100 yards to Dave’s Sushi. This home was built in 1918 and the second story was added in 2002. The open, spacious downstairs living area is the perfect place to call home while you explore all that the Bozeman area offers.
host_about: I moved to Bozeman in 2002 to ski-bum and...never left! I work for a Bozeman-based adventure travel company that plans trips to Yellowstone, Montana, and other beautiful natural places beyond. Extending this hospitality to hosting guests at our home has been very rewarding. I hope you have fun exploring all that Bozeman and the surrounding area offers. It's worth checking out!

This spacious, comfortable and well-appointed home in a quiet neighborhood is the perfect abode for your Bozeman visit. host_about:
Please call me Bob! I am the founder and chief scientist at the Yellowstone Ecological Research Center (YERC). Over my 30-plus years working in the Greater Yellowstone, my research interests have sought a more holistic connection between nature, people, and technology. That’s led to what I call “Adaptive Ecology,” studying not only how ecosystems adapt to changing conditions, but how the science of ecology must adapt to social and technological changes as well. That focus drives YERC’s mission today.

Personally, I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and finding common ground among cultures and communities.  I love sharing my knowledge of the Greater Yellowstone area and ecology, the best places to spot local wildlife, and my favorite watering holes in the area.

description: Welcome to this bright and modern centrally located home! host_about:
Hi, I'm Sarah!  I'm a born and raised Alaskan and love everything outdoors, rain, snow, or shine.  I've lived in Bozeman for the better part of a decade so needless to say I'm a wealth of information for all of the best spots.  

I've worked in the service industry for many years and pride myself on being a good host, whether its giving you your space or pointing you in the direction of the best dining experiences, outdoor recreating spots, or community activity.

I'm a low-key traveler who occasionally has a dog in tow.  I love crossword puzzles, mornings, Italian wine, and food.  And climbing.  And running.  Also, animals and puns.
