From the moment you step inside, you'll be immersed in a world of artistic inspiration and imagination. The interior of the rental is decorated with vibrant colors, intricate patterns, and unique furnishings that reflect the creativity and passion of artist/owners.
host_about:
Family. Friends. Mountains. Skiing. Real Estate. Photography. Big Adventures. 

Relationships are the most important thing in life, and time spent with friends and family is what I live for. The number of great friends that I met because of Airbnb is an ever-growing list that can no longer can be counted with just fingers and toes. 

Being a host has allowed me to travel and meet others without ever boarding a plane. It is a beautiful thing for me to learn about my guests and share my love for Big Sky and the mountains with them. 

And I believe that in all things, aesthetics matter.

La Dolce Vita means the sweet life in Italian. The owners are from Italy and have set this wonderful home up beautifully. It has a great euro feel and furnishings. It even has some amazing artwork!

Amazing three bedroom two bath home. Open floor plan is very accommodating and user friendly. Master has a bidet as well. Large fenced back yard and the home is pet friendly. Off leash dog park just down the street. Centrally located with a 2 car garage for guests to use as well.

host_about: Living and loving life. Looking for the next adventure.

name: Modern Luxury Condo near MSU
description: Come live the Bozeman lifestyle at this stunning 2 bed/2.5 bath Talbach condo. Stylishly designed with contemporary finishes, efficient floor-plan, & Euro-style windows that flood the space with light. A sliding glass door leads to a private balcony with mountain views. Features include A/C. The unit offers a covered parking space and a locked storage space. The building offers 2 gyms and an elevator. Conveniently located near MSU, Downtown Bozeman, & many outdoor recreation opportunities.
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: West side stay - 10 minutes to everywhere
description:
This is a great space for a Basecamp to your outdoor adventures here in Bozeman. Whether it’s skiing, fishing, or visiting family.
There’s extra space in the garage for storage or gear repairs.
I’m happy to give recommendations on the local attractions.
The room is spacious with a plush king sized bed and up stairs away from the main area in a shared home so you can expect a lot of privacy.
There’s also a set of friendly yet shy retired sled dogs around from time to time.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Cozy Valley West Studio | Full Kitchen & Laundry
description:
Whether planning a weekend getaway or an extended stay, this cozy, well-equipped studio is your gateway to relaxation and adventure in Bozeman. Located in the idyllic Valley West neighborhood, enjoy free parking, stunning mountain views, and proximity to a picturesque pond and park. It offers a full kitchen, bathroom, comfy bed, and essentials to make you feel right at home.

*Pet-friendly stay
*Dual washer/dryer
*Air conditioning unit
*Dedicated workspace and wifi
*Great neighborhood
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Downtown Charming & Cozy Casita - 3 BDRM
description: This downtown 3-Bedroom charming casita has a unique western-vintage style and is conveniently located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks within a 5-minute walk to downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, a Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Downtown Dream house
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, each with a queen bed, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Bozeman Creek House
description: Fantastic house and yard, 3 blocks from Main Street and right on Bozeman Creek as well as at the end of the street. New property starting in 2023! High speed wifi. A/C
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

Minutes from downtown, with Bridger Mountain views, indulge in luxury with hotel-style amenities, a wood fireplace, and comfy beds. Enjoy a spacious backyard & garage—perfect for snowy days. Close to nature & city delights, it’s a haven for relaxation and adventure. Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or an exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for your MT journey.
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Spacious Family Home | Privacy, Backyard w/ Patio
description:
Have fun making memories in this nostalgic, family-friendly retreat! The spacious backyard with a patio and outdoor seating is perfect for family fun and relaxation. With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and ample space, you'll enjoy all the amenities for a convenient and comfortable stay.

*Full kitchen
*Two living rooms
*Highchair and Pack 'n Play
*Dedicated workspace
*Washer and dryer
*Beautiful location
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Cool 50s Pad Near Downtown & MSU
description:
Cool, vintage 1950s, 3 bed/1 bath home, minutes to trails, MSU and Downtown! Close to ski areas, parks & rivers.

Designed by famed Bozeman architect, Fred Willson, for which Willson Ave is named. Step back in time with original period fixtures and furniture. Enjoy tons of natural light and heated floors throughout.

Includes: washer/dryer, large backyard, privacy fence, on-site parking.

Use this as a launch pad for your winter or summer adventure!

$135/night, minimum 30-day stay.

name: Fisherman’s Folly
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience, within a spacious centrally-located home.

Fully remodeled mid-century. Ten minute walk to main street with its restaurants, breweries, boutiques and galleries.

This is the owner’s principal residence so they’ve made it very warm and comfortable.

Double doors open to a patio and large backyard filled with plantings and whimsical touches. On the front side theres a lovely sitting area with a solo fire stove to enjoy.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Alpine Cottage
description: New for 2024! Fast WiFi. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Bozeman Homebase - 3 Bed, 2 Bath
description: Your perfect Bozeman homebase: minutes from downtown, MSU, and local attractions. Ideal for year-round adventures - 30 minutes to Bridgerowl Ski Area, 1 hour to Big Sky. host_about:
I'm a born and raised Montanan. I've done some traveling around the world and I just couldn't leave "The Last Best Place". I am a designer at A&E Design, a local Architecture and Design Firm. 

I live in the main house of the property with my black lab mix 'River'.  We spend a lot of our time outside on the river, slopes, hunting, camping, or hanging out in Historic Downtown Bozeman. 

We look forward to accommodating you and your adventure to this great town.

name: Cozy Historic Hideaway in Downtown Bozeman
description: Nestled in the basement of a charming historic property, this cozy 850 sq ft, two-bedroom, one-bathroom unit offers a private retreat in downtown Bozeman. With a blend of old-world charm and modern updates, the unit features in-unit laundry and amenities ideal for monthly stays. Just a block from Historic Main Street and near parks and trails, this space provides easy access to all Bozeman has to offer, making it perfect for those looking to embrace the vibrant downtown lifestyle.
host_about:
I'm a Bozeman native who lives in Austin with my wife, four daughters and our goldendoodle, Burrbon. We've lived in Chicago, Baltimore, and perhaps one day we'll be back in Montana. Until then, we love getting up there to visit when we can. We love the Sweet Pea festival and skiing Bridger and Big Sky. 

We love travel, adventure and creating memories together as a family.

name: Cinnabar Suite - Mountain Views
description: The Cinnabar Suite is a stylish 1-BR, 1.5-BA apartment in the heart of Bozeman, offering incredible Bridger Mountain views from the 3rd floor. It features a spacious king-size bedroom, high-speed WiFi, a fully equipped kitchen, in-unit laundry, and a cozy living area. A covered parking space adds convenience, while its central location makes exploring downtown Bozeman’s restaurants, shops, and the surrounding natural beauty easy. The Cinnabar Suite is perfect for both relaxation and adventure.
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.
